detaileddescription.para: The ownership policy of this container --- either SG::OWNS_ELEMENTS or SG::VIEW_ELEMENTS.

briefdescription.para: This actually holds the elements.
Reset indices / reorder aux data after elements have been permuted.

detaileddescription.para:
beg
Start of the range of elements to process.
end
End of the range of elements to process.
Call this after some operation that has permuted the elements in the container (such as sort). The index information in the elements will be used to permute all auxiliary data in the same way. Finally, all the indices will be reset in the correct order.

briefdescription.para: Test if we can insert; raise an exception if not.

detaileddescription.para:
op
Description of the attempted operation.
In order to maintain type-safety, we can only allow insertions using the most-derived instance of DataVector. This checks this by testing the m_isMostDerived, which is set by the constructors to true only for the most-derived instance. If the test fails, we call to potentially out-of-line code to continue.

briefdescription.para: Test if we can insert; raise an exception if not.

detaileddescription.para:
op
Description of the attempted operation.
This continues the test of testInsert. There is one case where m_isMostDerived may not be set correctly. If this container was made via copy construction, then all the m_isMostDerived flags will be false. So we call setMostDerived to set the flags correctly and test again. If the test fails again, then we raise an exception.

briefdescription.para: Helper for baseOffset.

detaileddescription.para:
p
Pointer to the start of the top-level object.
dv
Reference to the DataVector object.
ti
std::type_info of the desired class.
If ti represents a DataVector base class of this one, then return the offset of that base class. Otherwise, return -1.

memberdef.definition: static const T* DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::do_cast
memberdef.name: do_cast

briefdescription.para: Helper to shorten calls to DataModel_detail::DVLCast.

detaileddescription.para:
p
The value to convert.
The value as a const T*. This is a no-op for the base class.

briefdescription.para: Handle element assignment.

detaileddescription.para:
pos
Position in the container to assign.
newElem
The new element to assign.
The old element is freed if this container owns elements. Auxiliary data are copied if appropriate.

briefdescription.para: Handle element assignment from a base pointer.

detaileddescription.para:
pos
Position in the container to assign.
newElem
The new element to assign.
The old element is freed if this container owns elements. Auxiliary data are copied if appropriate.

briefdescription.para: Shift the auxiliary elements of the container.

detaileddescription.para:
pos
The starting index for the shift.
offs
The (signed) amount of the shift.
The elements in the container should have already been shifted; this operation will then adjust the element indices and also shift the elements in the vectors for all aux data items. offs may be either positive or negative.

If offs is positive, then the container is growing. The container size should be increased by offs, the element at pos moved to pos + offs, and similarly for following elements. The elements between pos and pos + offs should be default-initialized.

If offs is negative, then the container is shrinking. The element at pos should be moved to pos + offs, and similarly for following elements. The container should then be shrunk by -offs elements (running destructors as appropriate).

memberdef.definition: virtual const std::type_info& DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::dv_typeid
memberdef.name: dv_typeid

briefdescription.para: Find the most-derived DataVector class in the hierarchy.

detaileddescription.para: The type_info for the class for which this method gets run. This is used to generate a nice error message when the most-derived check for insertions fails. Every DataVector defines this virtual method, so when it's called, the one corresponding to the most-derived DataVector gets run.

briefdescription.para: Helper for erase(). Remove element at a given position.

detaileddescription.para:
position
Iterator pointing to the element to be removed.
An iterator pointing to the next element (or end()). This function factors out common code between erase() in the base and derived DataVector classes. It deals with the std::vector iterators directly.

briefdescription.para: Helper for erase(). Remove a range of elements.

detaileddescription.para:
first
Iterator pointing to the first element to be removed.
last
Iterator pointing one past the last element to be removed.
An iterator pointing to the element pointed to by last prior to erasing (or end()). This function factors out common code between erase() in the base and derived DataVector classes. It deals with the std::vector iterators directly.

briefdescription.para: Clear m_isMostDerived for this instance and for all bases.

detaileddescription.para: Called from the constructor after setting m_isMostDerived.

briefdescription.para: Set m_isMostDerived for this instance and clear it for all bases.

detaileddescription.para: Called from testInsert if the test fails. The flag may not have been set if this container was made via copy construction, so set it appropriately now so we can test again.

briefdescription.para: Default constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
ownPolicy
The ownership mode for the container.
trackIndices
The index tracking policy.
By default, a DataVector will own its elements. To avoid this, pass SG::VIEW_ELEMENTS for ownPolicy.

briefdescription.para: Sized constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
n
The size of the container.
ownPolicy
The ownership mode for the container.
trackIndices
The index tracking policy.
Note that unlike the standard vector constructor, you can't specify an initial value here. The container will be initialized with 0's.
By default, a DataVector will own its elements. To avoid this, pass SG::VIEW_ELEMENTS for ownPolicy.

briefdescription.para: Copy constructor.

detaileddescription.para:
rhs
The container from which to copy.
This is a `shallow' copy; the new container will not own its elements.

memberdef.argsstring: (InputIterator first, InputIterator last, SG::OwnershipPolicy ownPolicy=SG::VIEW_ELEMENTS, SG::IndexTrackingPolicy trackIndices=SG::DEFAULT_TRACK_INDICES, SG::IAuxStore *store=0)
memberdef.name: DataVector

briefdescription.para: Constructor from iterators.

detaileddescription.para:
first
The start of the range to put in the new container.
last
The end of the range to put in the new container.
ownPolicy
The ownership mode for the container.
trackIndices
The index tracking policy.
store
An associated auxiliary data store.
By default, a DataVector will own its elements (and take ownership of the pointers passed to this constructor). To avoid this, pass SG::VIEW_ELEMENTS for ownPolicy.

briefdescription.para: Assignment operator.

detaileddescription.para:
rhs
The DataVector from which to assign.
This object. This is a `shallow' copy; after the completion of this, the DataVector will not own its elements. Any elements it owned prior to this call will be released.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Assign from iterators.

detaileddescription.para:
first
The start of the range to put in the container.
last
The end of the range to put in the container.
Any existing owned elements will be released. The DataVector's ownership policy determines whether it will take ownership of the new elements.

briefdescription.para: Destructor.

detaileddescription.para: If this container owns its elements, the contained elements will be deleted as well. Before doing this, the destructor will scan for duplicate pointers (takes $n \log n$ time); duplicates are only destroyed once. Duplicates should, however, be considered an error; don't rely on this behavior.

briefdescription.para: Returns the number of elements in the collection.
Returns the number of elements in the collection.

detaileddescription.para: This version is virtual, to be callable from the AuxData base class.

briefdescription.para: Returns the size() of the largest possible collection.
Resizes the collection to the specified number of elements.

detaileddescription.para:
sz
The new size of the collection.
Note that this function differs from the standard in that it does not allow specifying the value of any inserted elements. They will always be 0.
If the container is shrunk, elements will be deleted as with erase().

briefdescription.para: Returns the total number of elements that the collection can hold before needing to allocate more memory.
Returns the total number of elements that the collection can hold before needing to allocate more memory.

detaileddescription.para: This version is virtual, to be callable from the AuxData base class.

briefdescription.para: Returns true if the collection is empty.
Attempt to preallocate enough memory for a specified number of elements.
Access an element, as an rvalue.

detaileddescription.para:
n
Array index to access.
The element at n. No bounds checking is done. Note that we return a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Access an element, as an rvalue.

detaileddescription.para:
n
Array index to access.
The element at n. This is a synonym for operator[] const, to be used when calling from root (where we can't readily call just the const version of a method).

briefdescription.para: Access an element, as an lvalue.

detaileddescription.para:
n
Array index to access.
Proxy to the element at n. No bounds checking is done. Note that we return a proxy object rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Access an element, as an rvalue.

detaileddescription.para:
n
Array index to access.
The element at n. Will raise std::out_of_range if the index is out-of-bounds. Note that we return a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Access an element, as an lvalue.

detaileddescription.para:
n
Array index to access.
Proxy to the element at n. Will raise std::out_of_range if the index is out-of-bounds. Note that we return a proxy object rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Access the first element in the collection as an rvalue.

detaileddescription.para: The first element in the collection. No checking is done to ensure that the container is not empty. Note that we return a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Access the last element in the collection as an rvalue.

detaileddescription.para: The last element in the collection. No checking is done to ensure that the container is not empty. Note that we return a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Access the first element in the collection as an lvalue.

detaileddescription.para: Proxy to the first element in the collection. No checking is done to ensure that the container is not empty. Note that we return a proxy object rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Access the last element in the collection as an lvalue.

detaileddescription.para: Proxy to the last element in the collection. No checking is done to ensure that the container is not empty. Note that we return a proxy object rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_iterator pointing at the beginning of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_iterator pointing past the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return an iterator pointing at the beginning of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: An iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a proxy rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Return an iterator pointing past the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: An iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a proxy rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_reverse_iterator pointing past the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_reverse_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_reverse_iterator pointing at the beginning of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_reverse_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return a reverse_iterator pointing past the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A reverse_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a proxy rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Return a reverse_iterator pointing at the beginning of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A reverse_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a proxy rather than a reference; the proxy will handle deleting an owned element if it's assigned to.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_iterator pointing at the beginning of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_iterator pointing past the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_reverse_iterator pointing past the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_reverse_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Return a const_reverse_iterator pointing at the beginning of the collection.

detaileddescription.para: A const_reverse_iterator. Note that dereferencing the iterator will yield a const T* rather than a reference.

briefdescription.para: Add an element to the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
pElem
The element to add to the collection.
The container's ownership policy will determine if it takes ownership of the new element.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Add an element to the end of the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
pElem
The element to add to the collection.
The container's ownership policy will determine if it takes ownership of the new element.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.
For DataVector, this is just the same as push_back. It's included just for interface compatibility with `stdvector`.

briefdescription.para: Add a new element to the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
position
Iterator before which the element will be added.
pElem
The element to add to the collection.
An iterator that points to the inserted data. The container's ownership policy will determine if it takes ownership of the new element.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Add a new element to the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
position
Iterator before which the element will be added.
pElem
The element to add to the collection.
An iterator that points to the inserted data. The container's ownership policy will determine if it takes ownership of the new element.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.
For DataVector, this is just the same as insert. It's included just for interface compatibility with `stdvector`.

briefdescription.para: Add a group of new elements to the collection.

detaileddescription.para:
position
Iterator before which the element will be added.
first
The start of the range to put in the container.
last
The end of the range to put in the container.
The container's ownership policy will determine if it takes ownership of the new element.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Remove element at a given position.

detaileddescription.para:
position
Iterator pointing to the element to be removed.
An iterator pointing to the next element (or end()). If the container owns its elements, then the pointed-to element will be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Remove a range of elements.

detaileddescription.para:
first
Iterator pointing to the first element to be removed.
last
Iterator pointing one past the last element to be removed.
An iterator pointing to the element pointed to by last prior to erasing (or end()). If the container owns its elements, then the removed elements will be deleted. Any duplicates will be removed in this process, but don't rely on this.

briefdescription.para: Remove the last element from the collection.

detaileddescription.para: If the container owns its elements, then the removed element will be deleted.

briefdescription.para: Erase all the elements in the collection.

detaileddescription.para: If the container owns its elements, then the removed elements will be deleted. Any duplicates will be removed in this process, but don't rely on this.

briefdescription.para: Swap this collection with another.

detaileddescription.para:
rhs
The collection with which to swap.
Ownership is swapped along with the collection content.
Note: this method may only be called using the most-derived DataVector in the hierarchy. The rhs must also be referenced using the most-derived DataVector.

briefdescription.para: Sort the container.

detaileddescription.para: This just sorts by pointer value, so it's probably not very useful.

briefdescription.para: Sort the container with a user-specified comparison operator.
Swap the referents of two DataVector iterators.

parameterdescription.para: The first iterator for the swap.
The second iterator for the swap/

briefdescription.para: Swap one element out of the container.

detaileddescription.para:
index
Index of the element in the container to swap.
newElem
New element to put in the container. May be 0.
oldElem
Reference to receive the element removed from the container.
Reference oldElem is initialized with element index of the collection (no bounds checking). Then element index is set to newElem. If the collection owns its elements, then it will take ownership of newElem and release (without deleting) the element returned through oldElem.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Swap one element out of the container.

detaileddescription.para:
pos
The element in the container to swap.
newElem
New element to put in the container. May be 0.
oldElem
Reference to receive the element removed from the container.
Reference oldElem is initialized with element pos of the collection (no bounds checking). Then element index is set to newElem. If the collection owns its elements, then it will take ownership of newElem and release (without deleting) the element returned through oldElem.
Note: this method may only be called using the most derived DataVector in the hierarchy.

briefdescription.para: Return the underlying std::vector of the container.

detaileddescription.para: Reference to the std::vector actually holding the collection. Note that DataVector<T>::stdcont does not necessarily return a std::vector<T*> if DataVector inheritance is being used.

briefdescription.para: Return the ownership policy setting for this container.
Erase all the elements in the collection, and reset the ownership mode.

detaileddescription.para:
ownPolicy
The new ownership policy of the container.
If the container owns its elements, then the removed elements will be deleted. Any duplicates will be removed in this process, but don't rely on this.

briefdescription.para: Erase all the elements in the collection, and reset the ownership mode.

detaileddescription.para:
ownPolicy
The new ownership policy of the container.
trackIndices
The index tracking policy.
If the container owns its elements, then the removed elements will be deleted. Any duplicates will be removed in this process, but don't rely on this.

memberdef.definition: virtual const DataModel_detail::DVLInfoBase& DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::dvlinfo_v
memberdef.name: dvlinfo_v

briefdescription.para: Return the DV/DL info struct for this class.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to make sure that it's instantiated.

briefdescription.para: Convert to AuxVectorBase.

detaileddescription.para: Needed to get AuxVectorBase from a ConstDataVector. Present in DataVector as well for consistency.

memberdef.definition: static const DataModel_detail::DVLInfoBase& DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::dvlinfo
memberdef.name: dvlinfo

briefdescription.para: Return the DV/DL info struct for this class.

detaileddescription.para: This can be used to make sure that it's instantiated.

briefdescription.para: Return the offset of a base DataVector class.

detaileddescription.para:
ti
std::type_info of the desired class.
If ti represents a DataVector base class of this one, then return the offset of that base class. Otherwise, return -1.
This function is here due to limitations of root 6, which can't calculate these offsets correctly from the dictionary if virtual derivation is used.

briefdescription.para: Mark as a sequence, for DataLink / ElementLink.

detaileddescription.para: This is the type of the underlying std::vector (what stdcont returns).

memberdef.definition: typedef T* const& DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::const_reference
memberdef.name: const_reference

memberdef.definition: typedef T* const* DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::const_pointer
memberdef.name: const_pointer

memberdef.definition: typedef const T* DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::const_value_type
memberdef.name: const_value_type

detaileddescription.para: The T value used as the template parameter. Note that this is different from value_type (that's T*).
This type is used to proxy lvalue accesses to DataVector elements, in order to handle ownership.

briefdescription.para: Standard const_iterator.

detaileddescription.para: Standard iterator. Note that lvalue references here will yield an ElementProxy, not a reference.

briefdescription.para: Standard const_reverse_iterator.

detaileddescription.para: Standard reverse_iterator. Note that lvalue references here will yield an ElementProxy, not a reference.

memberdef.definition: typedef ROOT_SELECTION_NS::DataVector<T, DataVector_BASE>::self DataVector< T, DataModel_detail::NoBase >::self
memberdef.name: self

detaileddescription.para: This is true for any DataVector class if we need to use virtual derivation to get to the base DataVector class. Since this is the base DataVector class, set this unconditionally to false.
This flag is true if this DV instance is the most-derived one. We set this to true in the top-level constructor; the constructor then calls clearMostDerived on the base classes.

briefdescription.para: The DV/DL info struct for this class.
Base specialization for DataVector<T>.

detaileddescription.para: This is used for the case where T does not derive from other classes. This is the class which actually holds the vector of pointers.
See the file comments for full details.
